alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 11 at 9:32AM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the Salinas River...including Bradley...Minor flooding is occuring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue as the Salinas River slowly recedes. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor flooding begins at the San Ardo oil fields. Significant flooding occurs along the lowest portions of towns from Bradley to Soledad. Erosion will cause minor damage to agricultural land. Some secondary roads from Bradley to Soledad will flood. ...At 16 ft, Minor flooding of agricultural land is expected. The lower portions of the San Ardo oil fields is closer to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PST Saturday the stage was 17.27 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM PST Saturday was 19.63 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 02/10/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 400 PM PST.
